Actions To Consider

If you want to limit your phone or social media use (or you have tried and failed), here are some tips:

  • Try taking small easy steps at first, which don't intrude on your life. Taking a step to not use your phone 30 mins before bed will be excruciatingly difficult when that's what you do before bed. A more reasonable first action would be to not bring your phone into the bathroom, and yes, it will be boring. That's the reality if you really want to limit what experiences involve your phone.
  • Start by tracking your use, instead of changing it. This will make you more aware of if your phone use is an issue, and if it is, how much. It's up to you make the call of what is too much.
    • An app I recommend to track your usage is StayFree (iOS & Android), which you can also set up limits in the future if you are interested in doing that sort of thing.

Self-Questionnaire

Here is a series of questions to ask yourself which may help you determine how much of an issue your phone/social media use is.

Points to include

This is a list of things to mention:

  • Provide introspective awareness of issues.
  • Facts pertaining to social media use (fair representation: good + bad)
  • Display small easy steps to take, which are largely non-intrusive.
  • Issues to ask reader to consider include:
    • Time Spend
    • Value Gained
    • Ask how much comparison is caused by social media.
      • Ask if the comparison leads to a negative emotional experience.
    • Ask the reader about other people they know who have had positive experiences without social media.
  • Display alternative ways to spend time.
    • Ask the reader to come up with them.
  • Be concrete:
    • DON'T claim that social media is the cause of all problems mentioned.
    • DON'T claim that removing social media fixes all problems mentioned.
    • DON'T claim that the only option is to remove social media.
  • Ask about:
    • If the time spend reflects the value gained

Keep in mind

Stages of change are continuous, and people jump around:

  • Pre-contemplative
  • Contemplation
  • Determination
  • Action (actually do a change)
  • Maintenance
